sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Double Cone Blender for homogeneous mixing of pharmaceutical powders, granules, and dry blends with gentle tumbling action.
sections.scope: Applicable to powder blending activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the blender is installed on a stable foundation with proper alignment.
Verify that the blending vessel is clean, dry, and free from previous material.
Check that all safety guards and interlocks are functioning properly.
Inspect the charging and discharging ports for cleanliness.
Weigh all ingredients accurately as per batch formula.
Open the charging port of the double cone blender.
Load ingredients into the blender through the charging port.
Fill the blender to 50-60% of total capacity for optimal blending.
Add ingredients in appropriate sequence if order matters for blend uniformity.
Close the charging port securely and ensure proper sealing.
Set the blending speed (typically 10-20 rpm for double cone blenders).
Set the blending time based on validation data (typically 15-30 minutes).
Start the blender and allow it to rotate for the specified duration.
Monitor the blending operation for any unusual noise or vibration.
After blending completion, stop the motor and allow vessel to stop rotating.
Position the blender for discharge by rotating to appropriate angle.
Open the discharge valve or port slowly.
Collect blended material into appropriate containers or transfer for further processing.
Take samples for blend uniformity testing as per sampling plan.
Clean the blender interior thoroughly using vacuum or brushes.
Close all ports and leave the blender ready for next operation.
Document blending time, speed, and observations in the batch manufacturing record.
precautions: Do not overload the blender beyond 60% capacity for effective blending.
Ensure proper sequence of ingredient addition to prevent segregation.
Avoid over-blending which may cause segregation of powder blends.
Check blend uniformity through proper sampling and analysis.
Ensure charging and discharge ports are properly sealed during operation.
Clean thoroughly between different products to prevent cross-contamination.
Inspect vessel interior for dead spots or material buildup.
Wear appropriate PPE including mask, gloves, and protective clothing.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
Perform line clearance verification before loading new batch.
